name: Stone table
explanation: Stones for resource and construction tables. Subtables have been sorted from common to rare. Subtables present stone types known in different types of genres and worlds. The first subtables are compatible with the largest number of worlds, and get more specialized towards the end. Non-generic subtables are not called by default to retain compatibility with most settings. Some subtables intentionally overlap. See also: metal.json. Authors: Johnn Four, Jochen Linnemann, Esko Vesala. Sources: Wikipedia.org.

tables.name: mythological
tables.explanation: Imaginary stone types once rumoured to have existed.

tables.name: rare mythological
tables.explanation: Rare imaginary stone types once rumoured to have existed.

tables.name: fantasy
tables.explanation: Imaginary stone types for fantasy worlds.

tables.name: rare fantasy
tables.explanation: Rare imaginary stone types for fantasy worlds.

tables.name: rare modern
tables.explanation: Rare stone types for modern worlds.

tables.name: futuristic
tables.explanation: Imaginary stone types for science fiction worlds.

tables.name: rare futuristic
tables.explanation: Rare imaginary stone types for science fiction worlds.
